titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Islamic Manuscripts Collection, 10th century - 19th century
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Emma Gronbeck, October 2024.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Codices and manuscript leaves from different parts of the Islamic World, primarily of the Qur'an and excerpts of the Qur'an. Also includes scholarly and literary works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Codices and manuscript leaves from different parts of the Islamic World, primarily of the Qur'an and excerpts of the Qur'an. Also includes scholarly and literary works.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

p.archref: Volume 6 of the Ernest Sturm Collection is an Arabic Qur’an from the Ottoman Empire.
The Ruth Lamb Atkinson Papers includes Persian and Sanskrit manuscript leaves and illustrations.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Illumination of books and manuscripts, Arab
Illumination of books and manuscripts, Iranian

Manuscripts, Arabic

Islamic illumination of books and manuscripts
Qur'an--Manuscripts

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Arabic MS 2, 8 and 9 were separated from the Medieval and Renaissance Manuscript Collection and incorporated into this collection, January 2024.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Arabic MS 3 was the gift of William Bancroft Hill, 1932.
Arabic MS 4 was the gift of Mrs. Lucien Howe, 1929.
Arabic MS 5 was the gift of Mildred E. Cook, 1959.
Arabic MS 6 was the gift of Janet (Bartlett) Cartwright (VC 1921), Jul 1957.
Arabic MS 7 was the gift of Ethel M. Fair (VC 1906), Nov 1971. Given to her by the Council and Faculties of the American University at Cairo in 1952.
Persian MS 1-4 and Turkish MS 1-2 were the bequest of Frederick F. Thompson, 1924.
Persian MS 5 was the gift of Ada Thurston (VC 1880), 1939.
Turkish MS 3 was the gift of Helen (Morgenthau) Fox (VC 1905), 1940.
Arabic MS 1 is of unknown origin.
Arabic MS 2, 8, and 9 are of unknown origin, possibly acquired from bookseller Otto F. Ege.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Islamic Manuscripts Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

did.unittitle: A Leaf from a Qur'an, in Arabic (Kufic script) [Persia?],
did.physdesc: [framed leaf in wooden case, 16 x 10 cm]

did.unittitle: A Leaf from a Qur'an (Sūrat al-Rūm), in Arabic (Maghribi script),
did.physdesc: [Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 51]

did.unittitle: Ṭabarsī, al-Faḍl ibn al-Ḥasan, (-1153), Hādhā Nathr al-La'ālī li-'Alī 'alayhi al-salām, in Arabic (Naskh script) [Persia],
Zayn al-ʻĀbidīn ʻAlī ibn al-Ḥusayn (-710?), A Leaf from Ṣaḥīfah al-Sajjādīyah, a book of supplications attributed to Imam Zayn al-Abidin (ca. 658–712), in Arabic [Persia],
did.physdesc: [Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 73]

did.unittitle: Jazūlī, Muḥammad ibn Sulaymān (1404-1465), A Leaf from Dalāʼil al-khayrāt [The Guide to Goodness], a compilation of prayers and salawat for the Prophet Muhammad, in Arabic [Persia],
did.physdesc: [Previously Medieval and Renaissance Manuscripts Collection, Leaf 70]

did.unittitle: Anonymous anthology of Persian poems [Persia (Meshed, Khorassav)],
Amīr Khusraw Dihlavī (approximately 1253-1325), Majnūn va Laylī [Book of Leili and Majnoon] [Persia],
Rashti, Agha Hussein, Book of Poetry [Persia],
Erzurumlu İbrâhim Hakkı (1703-1780?), Ma'rifet-nāme, in Ottoman Turkish (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],

p.emph: A scholarly encyclopedia covering, among other subjects, astronomy, astrology, anatomy, physiology, psychology, physics, mathematics, biology, geometry, physiognomy, faith, and Sufism.

did.unittitle: Kâtip Çelebi [Hajji Khalifa] (1609-1657), Cihannümâ, in Ottoman Turkish (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],

p.emph: This work is a comprehensive universal geographical history, featuring several colorful maps and atlases of various regions of the world. Marginal correction by the same scribe throughout.

did.unittitle: Prayer Book, in Turkish and Arabic (Naskh script) [Ottoman Empire],
